item.title: 克鲁索与红木公司合作利用废旧电池建立数据中心
item.description:
这是世界上规模最大的二次电池部署，显示了云计算运营商为寻找电源所付出的努力。【原文：

It’s the world largest deployment of batteries on their second life and shows the lengths cloud operators are going to find power.

】

item.title: 随着飓风季节的到来，关键预报工具的使用权将终止
item.description:
美国海军将不再分发某些卫星读数，此举将使预报员无法深入了解风暴的强度和结构。【原文：

The US Navy will no longer distribute certain satellite readings, a move that will leave forecasters without important insights into storms’ strength and structure.

】

item.title: 就在甘蔗糖厂放弃乙醇生产之际，巴西启动了生物燃料计划
item.description: 巴西为促进生物燃料发展而采取的最大措施之一，就是准备将过去几十年一直主导供应的生物燃料行业甩在身后。【原文：One of Brazil’s biggest steps to boost biofuels is poised to leave behind much of the industry that has dominated supplies for the past several decades.】

item.title: 雅典附近的野火迫使居民逃离，财产被烧毁
item.description: 雅典南部海岸的一场野火导致人员疏散，一些财产被毁。【原文：A wildfire on the coast south of Athens prompted evacuations as some properties were destroyed.】

item.title: 德国庞大的绿色预算在气候问题上出现了一些出人意料的挫折
item.description: 今天的时事通讯关注德国绿色支出提案中令人惊讶的气候挫折。如需不受限制地获取气候和能源新闻，请订阅。【原文：Today’s newsletter looks at the surprising climate setbacks within Germany’s green spending proposals. For unlimited access to climate and energy news, please subscribe.】

item.title: 英国不会支持 2,500 英里长的英国-摩洛哥海底电力电缆项目
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，英国政府不会支持价值 240 亿英镑（330 亿美元）的 Xlinks First Ltd. 项目，该项目将通过海底电缆从摩洛哥引入可再生能源。【原文：The UK government won’t back the £24 billion ($33 billion) Xlinks First Ltd. project to bring renewable energy from Morocco via undersea cables, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Meta 与开发商 Invenergy 签订更多清洁能源协议
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司与紧密控股的可再生能源开发商 Invenergy 签订了四份风能和太阳能发电合同，这是 Facebook 所有者为其运营和数据中心确保清洁电力来源所做努力的一部分。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. signed four contracts with closely held renewable energy developer Invenergy for wind and solar power as part of the Facebook-owner’s push to secure clean sources of electricity for its operations and data centers.】

item.title: 塞拉俱乐部以气候风险为由放弃贝莱德的资产管理业务
item.description: 美国最大的环保组织之一塞拉俱乐部正在从贝莱德公司撤资，理由是该资产管理公司在投资决策中 "拒绝""应对气候危机的系统性金融影响"。【原文：The Sierra Club, one of the largest environmental organizations in the US, is pulling money from BlackRock Inc., citing the asset manager’s “refusal” to “address the systemic financial implications of the climate crisis” in its investment decisions.】

item.title: 中国洪灾造成六人死亡，预报将有更多暴雨
item.description: 中国西南部的洪灾已导致六人死亡，气象官员警告说，预计未来几天还会有更多强降雨。【原文：Flooding in southwest China has led to the deaths of six people, and weather officials warn more heavy rainfall is expected in the coming days.】

item.title: 新加坡企业寻求推迟实施更严格的气候信息披露规定
item.description: 一个代表数千家新加坡企业的团体正在寻求推迟实施更严格的气候相关信息披露规则，理由是许多企业缺乏资源来达到标准。【原文：A group representing thousands of Singapore businesses is seeking a delay to the implementation of more stringent climate-related disclosure rules, arguing many firms lack resources to meet the standards.】

item.title: 前 Meta 首席技术官称人工智能将掀起新一轮能源创新浪潮
item.description:
前 Meta 首席技术官、现气候风险投资人 Mike Schroepfer 在《零点》播客中说："能源获取已成为董事会讨论的话题，这在四年前是不可能的。【原文：

“Energy access has become a boardroom conversation in a way that wasn’t true literally four years ago,” Mike Schroepfer, former Meta CTO and now climate VC, tells the Zero podcast.

】

item.title: 库存飙升后美国允许乙烷运往中国
item.description: 特朗普政府最近略微放宽了对一种用于制造塑料的石油气的出口限制；这一转变表明，在与中国的贸易谈判中，作为筹码的限制措施略有回调。【原文：The Trump administration has slightly eased recent export limits on a petroleum gas that’s used to make plastics — a shift that represents a modest pullback on curbs used as leverage in trade negotiations with China.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯在关键的夏季来临之前发布电动超跑概念车
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰集团（Mercedes-Benz Group AG）展示了一款电动超跑概念车，该概念车采用了梅赛德斯-奔驰将于明年向客户提供的技术，梅赛德斯-奔驰将进一步推动下一代汽车的发展。【原文：Mercedes-Benz Group AG presented a concept for an electric hypercar incorporating technology that will be available to customers from next year as the manufacturer pushes further into next-generation vehicles.】

item.title: 墨西哥总统辛鲍姆称太空探索技术公司污染了边境地区
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）说，SpaceX 在得克萨斯州发射的 "星际飞船 "火箭碎片污染了边境地区。【原文：SpaceX’s Starship rocket launches in Texas have polluted an area across the border with debris, Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.】

item.title: 卡尼能源公司总裁寻求在重大项目中获得土著股权
item.description: 在首相马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）的政府准备大力推进大型新能源和基础设施项目之际，他的自然资源部长表示，他希望原住民团体能够在这些项目中获得大量的所有权股份。【原文：As Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government prepares to plow forward on major new energy and infrastructure projects, his natural resources minister says he wants Indigenous groups to pursue large ownership stakes in them.】

item.title: 三哩岛有望提前提供核电
item.description: 星座能源公司（Constellation Energy Corp）重启三里岛核电站的工作进展比预期要快，该公司现在表示，宾夕法尼亚州的核电站将比预测更早地开始发电。【原文：Constellation Energy Corp.’s efforts to restart the Three Mile Island plant are moving faster than expected, with the company now saying the Pennsylvania nuclear site will begin producing power earlier than forecast.】

item.title: 洛杉矶烟雾毒害房屋加深保险噩梦
item.description: 洛杉矶的太平洋帕利塞德社区被大火烧毁数月后，房主们正努力争取赔偿；不是因为房屋被烧成废墟，而是因为烟雾和毒素对剩余房产造成的损害。【原文：Months after fire tore through Los Angeles’ Pacific Palisades neighborhood, homeowners are struggling to get reimbursed — not for houses reduced to rubble, but for the damage of smoke and toxins in the properties that remain.】

item.title: 巴西绿色能源产业正在成为自身成功的牺牲品
item.description:
巴西的风能和太阳能公司一直受到供应链障碍、高借贷成本和输电线路匮乏的影响

。【原文：

Brazilian wind and solar companies have been hit by supply-chain snags, high borrowing costs and a dearth of transmission lines

】

item.title: 土耳其加紧与澳大利亚竞争主办 COP31 峰会
item.description: 土耳其正在加紧竞选明年联合国年度气候会谈的主办国，与澳大利亚的竞争提案相抗衡，因为该活动吸引了数万名代表参加。【原文：Turkey is ramping up a campaign to host next year’s annual United Nations climate talks, rivaling a competing proposal from Australia for the event that attracts tens of thousands of delegates.】

item.title: 气候资金减少引发最脆弱国家指数上升
item.description:
该指数确定了洪水和热浪等灾害风险高但融资渠道少的国家。【原文：

The index identifies countries that are at high risk of hazards, like floods and heat waves, but have little access to finance.

】

item.title: 新加坡航空公司因排放增加而增加气候相关成本
item.description: 新加坡航空公司（Singapore Airlines Ltd.）警告说，随着客运量和货运量的增长，排放量也随之增加，该公司面临着与气候相关的合规成本挑战。【原文：Singapore Airlines Ltd. has warned it faces cost challenges from climate-related compliance as emissions rise on growing passenger and freight volumes.】

item.title: 热浪威胁欧洲各地的发电量和野火
item.description: 欧洲的热浪正在加剧，助长了整个地中海地区的野火，并有可能抑制核电站和水电站的发电量。【原文：Europe’s heat wave is intensifying, fueling wildfires across the Mediterranean and threatening to curb electricity generation from both nuclear and hydropower plants.】

item.title: 专家称国防预算需用于应对战争和气候变化
item.description:
在军事冲突不断升级、全球气温不断升高的背景下，北约将于本周在海牙举行峰会。【原文：

A NATO summit in The Hague this week comes amid escalating military conflicts and rising global temperatures.

】

item.title: 电动汽车价格战持续，CATL 优先考虑海外扩张
item.description: 全球最大的电动汽车电池制造商当代安培瑞斯科技有限公司（Contemporary Amperex Technology Co.全球最大的电动汽车电池制造商安培瑞斯科技有限公司（Amperex Technology Co., Ltd.）首席制造官倪军称，由于中国国内汽车市场的激烈竞争威胁到该行业的健康发展，该公司正将海外扩张作为 "第一要务"。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., the world’s largest electric vehicle battery maker, is making overseas expansion its “No. 1 priority” as intense competition in China’s domestic car market threatens the industry’s health, according to Chief Manufacturing Officer Ni Jun.】

item.title: 日本热浪可能持续数周，刺激能源需求
item.description: 由于气温仍然远高于平均水平，预计日本在未来两周内将继续烘烤，这可能会促进能源需求，并使电力价格持续走高。【原文：Japan is forecast to continue baking over the next two weeks as temperatures remain well above average, likely boosting energy demand and keeping power prices elevated.】

item.title: 英国气候监察机构警告称，建筑业繁荣可能导致排放量飙升
item.description: 英国气候变化委员会警告说，除非政府加快制定低碳供暖要求，否则在本十年结束前建造 150 万套新住宅的计划可能会导致排放量激增。【原文：The UK’s Climate Change Committee warned that a plan to build 1.5 million new homes before the end of the decade may cause emissions to spike unless the government expedites a requirement for low-carbon heating.】

item.title: 纽约中央公园气温高达 99 华氏度，创下新的日气温纪录
item.description: 周二下午，纽约中央公园的气温高达华氏 99 度（摄氏 37 度），选民们正前往投票站参加市长初选，酷热难耐。高温使电网不堪重负，人们呼吁节约能源。【原文：New York’s Central Park reached 99F (37C) Tuesday afternoon, with blistering heat searing down as voters headed to the polls for the city’s mayoral primary race. The high temperatures are straining power grids and leading to calls for energy conservation.】

item.title: 美国共和党考虑修改税收抵免法案，太阳能股票飙升
item.description: 一位共和党参议员称，立法者正在讨论修改唐纳德-特朗普总统的广泛支出法案中的一项条款，该条款将突然终止对屋顶太阳能电池板的税收抵免，随后太阳能公司股价大涨。【原文：Shares of solar companies surged after a Republican Senator said lawmakers are discussing changes to a provision in President Donald Trump’s broad spending bill that would abruptly end tax credits for rooftop panels.】

item.title: 欧盟国家寻求新的碳市场变革以防止价格过高
item.description: 一些欧盟国家希望改变该地区新的碳市场，以防止价格飙升引发对雄心勃勃的气候措施的反弹。【原文：A group of European Union countries want changes to the region’s new carbon market in order to prevent a surge in prices that could trigger a backlash against ambitious climate measures.】

item.title: 法国立法者否决太阳能和风能项目暂停令
item.description: 法国议会下院否决了一项能源规划法案，该法案将暂停新的太阳能和风能项目。【原文：France’s lower house of Parliament rejected an energy-planning bill that would have imposed a moratorium on new solar and wind projects.】
